persons.name: Pindar
persons.description: An Ancient Greek lyric poet from Thebes. Of the canonical nine lyric poets of ancient Greece, his work is the best preserved.

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

persons.name: Thucydides
persons.description: An Athenian historian and general, his History of the Peloponnesian War recounts the fifth-century BCE war between Sparta and Athens until the year 411 BCE.

persons.name: JesusChrist
persons.description: The central figure of Christianity; a first-century Jewish preacher and religious leader.

persons.name: Jupiter
persons.description: Also known as Jove, the god of the sky and thunder, and king of the gods in ancient Roman religion and mythology.

places.name: Japan
places.description: an island country in East Asia. It is in the northwest Pacific Ocean.

places.name: Iceland
places.description: A Nordic island country between the North Atlantic and Arctic Oceans.

places.name: Mediterranean Sea
places.description: Connected to the Atlantic Ocean and almost completely surrounded by land.

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

places.name: Kamchatka Krai
places.description: The Kamchatka Peninsula is a 1,250-kilometre-long peninsula in the Russian Far East.

places.name: Sicily
places.description: Sicily is the largest and most populous island in the Mediterranean Sea and one of the twenty regions of Italy.

places.name: United States
places.description: The U.S. is a country of 50 states covering a vast swath of North America, with Alaska in the northwest and Hawaii extending the nation’s presence into the Pacific Ocean.

works.name: Odes of Pindar, with several other Pieces in Prose and Verse
works.author: Pindar

persons.name: Strabo
persons.description: Greek geographer, philosopher, and historian who lived in Asia Minor during the transitional period of the Roman Republic into the Roman Empire.

persons.name: DiodorusSiculus
persons.description: Of Sicily was an ancient Greek historian. He is known for writing the monumental universal history Bibliotheca historica, in forty books, fifteen of which survive intact, between 60 and 30 BCE.

places.name: Rome
places.description: The capital of Italy.

places.name: Auvergne
places.description: A region of central France known for its mountain ranges and dormant volcanoes.

places.name: Herculaneum
places.description: Herculaneum was an ancient Roman town, located in the modern-day comune of Ercolano, Campania, Italy.

persons.name: WilliamHamilton
persons.description: English diplomat, politician, antiquarian, and vulcanologist who served as the Envoy Extraordinary to the Kingdom of Naples from 1764 to 1800. FRSL.

persons.name: Déodat Gratet deDolomieu
persons.description: French geologist. The rock, and region of the Alps, dolomite was named after him.

persons.name: ScipioneBreislak
persons.description: Italian geologist of Swedish parentage. The vast works for the refining of sulphur in the volcanic district of Solfatara, near Naples, were erected under his direction. Professor of physics at the University of Ragusa, and subsequently at the Collegio Nazereno in Rome. He witnessed an eruption of Vesuvius in 1794 and subsequntly wrote Voyage Physique et Lithologique dans la Campagnie (1801).

persons.name: John ThomasStanley
persons.description: A British landowner and amateur scienticist, in 1789 he made a celebrated voyage to the Faroe Islands and Iceland with James Wright, Isaac Benners and John Baine, including the climbing of Mount Hekla. In the same year he was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh.

places.name: Campania
places.description: A region of Italy; most of it is in the south-western portion of the Italian peninsula (with the Tyrrhenian Sea to its west), but it also includes the small Phlegraean Islands and the island of Capri.

places.name: Edinburgh
places.description: The capital city of Scotland.

works.name: Earth and Environmental Science Transactions of The Royal Society of Edinburgh
works.author: Sir John Stanley

persons.name: Alexander vonHumboldt
persons.description: German geographer, naturalist and explorer. ForMemRSL.

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

places.name: Mount Vesuvius
places.description: Mount Vesuvius is a somma-stratovolcano located on the Gulf of Naples in Campania, Italy.

places.name: Kamchatka Krai
places.description: The Kamchatka Peninsula is a 1,250-kilometre-long peninsula in the Russian Far East.

places.name: Andes
places.description: Mountain range in western South America.

persons.name: Giulio CesareBraccini
persons.description: An abbot from Lucca, Italy, who witnessed the 1631 eruption of Vesuvius, and wrote an account of it, Dell’incendio fattosi nel Vesuvio a’ XVI di dicembre M.DC.XXXI (Naples 1632).

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

places.name: Catania
places.description: An ancient port city in Italy, on Sicily's east coast.

persons.name: FrancescoFerrara
persons.description: Italian geologist, active mainly in Sicily, and known especially for his vulcanology studies.

persons.name: Uno vonTroil
persons.description: Swedish traveller and the archbishop of Uppsala. He travelled to Iceland with Joseph Banks.

places.name: Iceland
places.description: A Nordic island country between the North Atlantic and Arctic Oceans.

places.name: Hekla
places.description: Hekla is a volcano in Iceland. It has erupted many times in recorded history. 1766-68 was the eruption closest to Davy's time.

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

persons.name: LazzaroSpallanzani
persons.description: Italian priest, biologist and physiologist.

places.name: Stromboli
places.description: an island in the Tyrrhenian Sea, off the north coast of Sicily, containing Mount Stromboli, one of the four active volcanoes in Italy. It is one of the seven Aeolian Islands, a volcanic arc north of Sicily.

persons.name: WilliamHamilton
persons.description: English diplomat, politician, antiquarian, and vulcanologist who served as the Envoy Extraordinary to the Kingdom of Naples from 1764 to 1800. FRSL.

persons.name: ScipioneBreislak
persons.description: Italian geologist of Swedish parentage. The vast works for the refining of sulphur in the volcanic district of Solfatara, near Naples, were erected under his direction. Professor of physics at the University of Ragusa, and subsequently at the Collegio Nazereno in Rome. He witnessed an eruption of Vesuvius in 1794 and subsequntly wrote Voyage Physique et Lithologique dans la Campagnie (1801).

places.name: Mount Somma
places.description: A mountain located in the Province of Naples, in the Campania region of southern Italy. It has a collapsed caldera of an older volcano, with Mount Vesuvius rising up from the center.

places.name: Naples
places.description: Naples is the regional capital of Campania in Italy. It is located beneath the volcano, Vesuvius.

places.name: Torre del Greco
places.description: A comune in the Metropolitan City of Naples in Italy. Located at the foot of Mount Vesuvius, Torre del Greco was partly destroyed in an eruption of the volcano in 1631.

places.name: Herculaneum
places.description: Herculaneum was an ancient Roman town, located in the modern-day comune of Ercolano, Campania, Italy.

places.name: Naples
places.description: Naples is the regional capital of Campania in Italy. It is located beneath the volcano, Vesuvius.

places.name: Resina
places.description: Now Ercolano, Resino was a medieval town built on the lava stream left by the eruption of Vesuvius (AD 79) that destroyed the ancient city of Herculaneum, from which the present name is derived.

places.name: Naples
places.description: Naples is the regional capital of Campania in Italy. It is located beneath the volcano, Vesuvius.

places.name: Ottaviano
places.description: A comune in the Italian region of Campania, located about 20 kilometres east of Naples in the Vesuvian Area.

places.name: Torre del Greco
places.description: A comune in the Metropolitan City of Naples in Italy. Located at the foot of Mount Vesuvius, Torre del Greco was partly destroyed in an eruption of the volcano in 1631.

places.name: Naples
places.description: Naples is the regional capital of Campania in Italy. It is located beneath the volcano, Vesuvius.

persons.name: Lucretius
persons.description: Roman poet and philosopher. His only known work is the materialist philosophical poem De rerum natura.

places.name: Iceland
places.description: A Nordic island country between the North Atlantic and Arctic Oceans.

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

persons.name: HenryCavendish
persons.description: A central figure in English natural philosophy and chemistry, among other research he determined the density of the earth and discovered what would later be named hydrogen. He was one of the people who helped appoint Davy to the Royal Institution. Following his death in 1810 Davy delivered a widely-quoted eulogy on Cavendish and later arranged for some of his apparatus to be transferred to the Royal Institution. FRSL.

persons.name: NevilMaskelyne
persons.description: Astronomer Royal and a Commissioner of the Board of Longitude. Contributed to scientifically measuring the density of the Earth. FRSL.

persons.name: JamesHutton
persons.description: Scottish geologist, agriculturalist and chemical manufacturer. His Theory of the Earth (1795) is one of the foundations of modern geology. Davy discussed Hutton's theories in his lectures and visited some of the key geological sites that Hutton used in his work.

persons.name: RobertHooke
persons.description: Natural philosopher who acted as experimental demonstrator at the Royal Society of London during its early years. Prominent in the study of air and microscopy amongst other subjects. FRSL.

persons.name: JamesHall
persons.description: Scottish baronet (1776) and MP. Chemist and geologist who supported of James Hutton's theories of uniformitarian geology. FRSL.

persons.name: GregoryWatt
persons.description: Youngest son of James Watt. Lodged with Davy's mother in Penzance during the winter of 1797-8 and became close friends with Davy.

places.name: London
places.description: The capital city of England and the United Kingdom.

works.name: Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society of London
works.author: Gregory Watt

places.name: Azores
places.description: An autonomous region of Portugal, the Azores are an archipelago in the mid-Atlantic.

places.name: Herculaneum
places.description: Herculaneum was an ancient Roman town, located in the modern-day comune of Ercolano, Campania, Italy.

places.name: Lipari
places.description: A commune including six of seven islands of the Aeolian Islands located in the Tyrrhenian Sea off the northern coast of Sicily in southern Italy.

places.name: Pompeii
places.description: An ancient city located in what is now the comune of Pompei near Naples in the Campania region of Italy. Pompeii was buried in volcanic ash in the Eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 CE.

places.name: Santorini
places.description: One of the Cyclades islands in the Aegean Sea. The island was devastated by a volcanic eruption in the 16th century BC.
